name: The BodyHoliday, LeSport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a 9 night stay at Le Sport. We were last there in 2001 and it was every bit as good as we remembered. So many activities to choose from that it was sometimes just impossible to fit them all in. Golf with Edwin is a real joy -- he is so patient and encouraging and even after three lessons the improvement in my game was marked. The treatments were good but perhaps an extra couple could be introduced so that there was less repetition over the stay-- this just a minor point and does not detract from the overall excellent standard.
reviews.title: Even tropical storm Patty could not spoil this wonderful resort!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was plenty of choice at meal times and again overall the food was excellent. Don't miss Head Chef Scott's cookery lesson -- really good fun! The food and service in Tao is a special treat.
reviews.title: Just like the pictures!
Very good, but room(s) for improvement!
reviews.text: The ' Water boys' were very organised and professional and we felt safe out on the water which was good as we are not the best swimmers.
Overall a wonderful break and a really excellent resort; not even tropical storm Patty could spoil it as the Activities staff organised a quiz and other indoor activities.
reviews.title: The perfect place to recharge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only downside is the 90 minute trip to the airport but we booked with St Lucia Airport Shuttle (with Janus) and it was troublefree and reasonably priced with no payment up front. Transfer by air conditioned car with a safe and informative driver eased the journey a lot.
reviews.title: Truly Pampered

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned after a wonderful relaxing holiday at The Bodyholiday, which although expensive, I would say is extremely good value for money.
reviews.title: Relaxing!

reviews.text: Unlike the previous reviewer, I found the staff friendly, efficient, helpful, knowledgable and they go beyond the call of duty to make your stay comfortable and enjoyable. This, despite the fact that no-one receives any tips (there appears to be a non-tipping etiquette at The Bodyholiday, indeed no-one carries any money with them during their stay).
reviews.title: Was amazing pre renovation but not good in 2012

reviews.text: I went during the "Octoba Yoga" program which I can't recommend highly enough. The guest teachers Angie and Andrea were superb and have really ignited my passion for yoga, and inspired me to keep up the good work at home. I am not sure what the yoga classes would be like without the guest teachers, but I would definitely like to return for another yoga program.
reviews.title: Chillax in style

reviews.text: I am used to having spa treatments in London and on the whole, the inclusive spa treatments were very good. Out of 10 treatments, I would say 7-8 were extremely good, and the others were average-good. Some of the therapists seemed a little grumpy, but overall I was very happy with the spa experience. On the advice of one of the therapists, I paid for a deep tissue massage additionally (special offer 50US dollars for 30 minutes) and this was great.
reviews.title: Fabulous and nearly perfect - super friendly & good service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were a bit worried about going during October (hurricane season) but the weather was absolutely fine. Cloudy/rainy for the first two days as a tropical depression passed through (but we still enjoyed swimming in the sea and all the activities), then absolutely fine for the rest of the stay, mainly sunny with occasional clouds and showers, but this provided some welcome respite from the intense heat.
reviews.title: Great Experience!!!
Total relaxation
reviews.text: My husband and I spent June 5-11 at LeSport and found it to have exceeded our expectations. We arrived at 1am, due to a delayed flight and check-in was a breeze and there were plates made up in our room with sodas, as we missed dinner.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Possibly the best investment in yourself that you could ever make. Simply put this resort has everything you could possibly want. The location and property are stunning, set in beautifully manicured grounds on leeward side of the island. The amount and variety of activities is amazing and so easy to participate in. For restless traveller it is a pure delight. For those that simply want to chill then the inclusive treatments ease any remnants of tension that may remain (which is doubtful). The resort provides a culinary treat throughout your stay with a variety of cuisine to challenge the hardiest dieter. If you've read their website then I won't bore you with any more of the physical highlights. The thing that makes this such a memorable holiday is the warmth of all the staff and the community feel with the other guests. There is a home away from home feel. All of the many high points are better covered by other reviews but if the proof of the pudding is in the eating, i'm looking forward to my fourth helping in the new year, and I wouldn't mind seconds :-).
reviews.title: The best sunshine holiday....bar none

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent a week at Le Sport in the beginning of October and really loved it. There are a lot of activities but we only did a few as we preferred to enjoy the sea and the beach. The inclusive spa treatments were great , especially enjoyed the aloe Vera body wrap and the facial . My husband really liked the hydrotherapy. I did the aqua aerobics class which was fun and we did the zip lining ( that's not based at the hotel) and it was brilliant.
reviews.title: Wonderful week,

reviews.text: The food was very good and the buffet on Wednesday night at the cariblue restaurant was excellent. The food at the clubhouse was mainly grill, pizza and pasta , all very tasty, especially the pasta sauces.
reviews.title: A perfect balance of sun, sport, spa, scuba and sea

reviews.text: The service was superb as well as the evening entertainment, though it was only till11.30 but then you can go to the piano bar as long as someone can play the piano as the pianist also finishes around midnight.
reviews.title: Great Value - Total relaxation - exceeded expectations

reviews.text: The only thing was that our room was damp and even the dehumidifier could not remove the smell,but we were not really bothered and in no way it spoilt our holiday, otherwise the room was very clean.
reviews.title: Great holiday and will be back for more...
Wonderful Time
reviews.text: Just returned from a week at LeSport. The time flew by and we wished we could have stayed longer. First a word of warning for anyone flying American Airlines through San Juan into George Charles Airport. The airport location is great, just 20 minutes from the resort, but American Airlines did not have luggage for about a third of the people on the flight including us. Luckily we always pack a swim suit and evening clothes in our carryone but a couple on their honeymoon that took the taxi to LeSport with us was not as lucky. We did not receive our bags until 10pm the next evening. Everyone we talked to at the resort and on the way to the resort seemed to know that this was a common problem. Wish we had been warned. Be sure to pack for a couple of days in your carry on if you fly AA.

reviews.title: not so good
reviews.text: We were in room 335 and had a beautiful view of the ocean and Pigeon Point (rooms 333 - 337 had the same view). The room has nice marble tile and the bathroom was covered in marble and very nice. This is our 4rth trip to the Caribbean so we expect some bugs and mildew and were pleasantly surprised at the cleanliness. I always bring a candle and linen spray to take care of any must odor. The air condition seemed to struggle a bit. It was cool but never cold and the thermostat does not really work - it justy blows cool air constantly. It was fine for me my husband was a little warm at times. In the middle of the night I would get a little chilly and pull the comforter up. My only disappointment was that the room got sandier as the week went on - I don't think they did a very good job of sweeping daily.

I went on my own as I knw the resort is singles friendly. You don't get hit with single supplements and still have a fantastic room. There are communal dining tables available at dinner. There are lots of single travellers (especially women) and the environment is such that everyone interacts and talks so you never actually feel alone (if you don't want to be!) I never ate on the communal table as always found someone to go with. Except at the lovely Asian fusion restaurant Tao where I was given a reservation at checkin.
reviews.title: Great for single travellers (planning to go back in 2013)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Much has been said about the rest of the hotel - excellent food options all day long. Accommodation is good. There is a wide variety of included activities on offer (check the online activities schedule to get an diea). The staff are soooo very helpful and friendly. The ladies up at the spa are super and you come away feeling totally relaxed.
reviews.title: Truly All Inclusive and Impeccable Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I also did a Daley Thomson / Kate Staples Well Fit (boot camp) fitness week while there. They run this two times a year (March & Nov) which costs extra but fun and well worth the money. I am looking to book again for March next year as I liked the resort and Fit Well program so much !!
reviews.title: The Best Holiday for your body and mind

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent a week at the Body in October and enjoyed every minute of it. As the name suggests, the hotel ethos is about health and fitness and attracts like minded singles and couples in the 30 - 55 age range (no under 16's and hardly any pensioners or people in their twenties)
reviews.title: only for two nights but well worth the money

reviews.text: Whats good - well pretty much everything is of a high standard and is included in the basic price (motorised watersports, sailing, all exercise classes (except scuba) all food and drink and an hour long treatment in the wellness facility every day.
reviews.title: Pretty fab

description: The BodyHoliday, LeSPORT - The only vacation to combine the pleasures of personalized rejuvenation in a luxurious holiday environment with the opportunity to acquire skills and insights that will enhance the rest of your life.
